isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 11: ENGINE ELECTRICAL - MAIN ENGINE WIRING HARNESS - ASSEMBLY

note.para: Assembly procedures, for engines equipped with separately mounted ecm and idm units or engines equipped with the engine mounted ecm unit, are the same except where noted.
Refer to Section 12, "HIGH PRESSURE LUBE OIL SYSTEM" for the proper installation procedure for the IPR valve.

step1.para: . If removed, install the EOP, ECT, MAP and EOT sensors into their proper locations and tighten.

note.para: Refer to steps 2 and 3 for installation procedures for the CMP and ICP sensors.

step1.para:
Install CMP sensor, if removed, into front cover as follows ( Figure 11.42
):

step2.para: If it is necessary to check the clearance of the CMP sensor, refer to "Verifying CMP Sensor Clearance" in this section.
Place new O-Ring onto CMP sensor and lubricate with clean engine oil. Insert into front cover.
Secure CMP sensor to front cover with mounting bolt. Tighten bolt.

step1.para: Install the ICP sensor as follows:

para.emph: Engines Equipped With Old Three-Way Fitting

note.para: Be sure to clean any and all old Loctite(r) found on the threads of the sensor prior to installation.

step3.para: Apply Loctite #277 to the threads of the ICP sensor.

Install Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor, together with O-Ring, to the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 11.43
). Tighten to the special torque value.

figure.caption: Figure 11.43 Installing The ICP Sensor Into The Old Three-Way Fitting

para.emph: Engines Equipped With New Three-Way Fitting

step3.para: Apply Loctite #277 to the threads of the ICP sensor.

Install Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor, together with O-Ring, to the three-way fitting of the supply manifold ( Figure 11.44
). Tighten to the special torque value.

para.emph: Engines Equipped With New Three-Way Fitting

step3.para: Apply Loctite #277 to the threads of the ICP sensor.

Install Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor, together with O-Ring, to the supply manifold ( Figure 11.45
). Tighten to the special torque value.

note.para: BE CERTAIN THAT EACH CONNECTOR HAS ITS RIBBED SEAL IN PLACE BEFORE INSTALLING ONTO SENSOR. IN SOME CASES, UPON DISASSEMBLY, A RIBBED SEAL MAY PULL OFF OF ITS CONNECTOR AND REMAIN IN THE MATING SOCKET OF A SENSOR OR ACTUATOR. A CONNECTOR ASSEMBLED WITHOUT THE APPROPRIATE RIBBED SEAL CAN BECOME CONTAMINATED WITH MOISTURE AND CORRODE TERMINALS RESULTING IN A POOR ELECTRICAL CONNECTION

step1.para: Install wiring harness onto the engine and carefully align connectors with sensors. Push each connector into its mating socket until locking tabs are fully latched.
Install the two ECM gaskets into the ECM connector receptacles.
Open the foam insert at the slit and place around the chassis and engine wiring harnesses, near the connectors.

Connect the engine wiring harness to the ECM ( Figure 11.46
)

figure.caption: Figure 11.44 Installing The ICP Sensor Into The New Three-Way Fitting
Figure 11.45 Installing The ICP Sensor Into The Supply Manifold

step1.para:
Tighten the connector retaining screw to the special torque value ( Figure 11.47
).
Install and connect the second wiring harness to the ECM. Tighten the connector retaining screw to the special torque value.

Install the ECM connector covers ( 3, Figure 11.48
) over the wiring harness connectors.

note.para: Be sure the foam inserts fit into the end channel of the connector covers before securing to the covers to the connectors.
